text: Orson is an unincorporated community in Harrison County, in the U.S. state of Iowa. ==History== Orson was laid out in 1899 when the railroad was extended to that point. The community was named for Orson Pratt, a Mormon leader. A post office was established at Orson in 1900, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1957. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Harrison County, Iowa Category:Unincorporated communities in Iowa
title: Orson, Iowa
